citation: Source: MIAE-221 Materials Science and Engineering (Chapters 1-5) - Callister & Rethwisch 10th Edition

questions.question: A BCC iron crystal has an atomic radius of 0.1241 nm. What is the theoretical density of this iron if the atomic weight is 55.85 g/mol?
For an FCC crystal structure, what is the relationship between atomic radius (R) and lattice parameter (a)?

If the equilibrium number of vacancies in copper at 1000°C is 2.2 × 10¹⁸ vacancies/m³, and the activation energy for vacancy formation is 0.9 eV/atom, approximately how many vacancies per m³ would exist at 500°C?

For interstitial diffusion of carbon in γ-iron (FCC) at 900°C, if it takes 10 hours to achieve a carbon concentration of 0.8 wt% at 2 mm below the surface, approximately how long would it take to achieve the same concentration at 3 mm depth?
Which combination of factors according to Hume-Rothery rules would predict the HIGHEST solubility for a substitutional solid solution?
options: 15% size difference, same crystal structure, similar electronegativity, higher valence solute
8% size difference, different crystal structure, large electronegativity difference, lower valence solute
25% size difference, same crystal structure, similar electronegativity, same valence
5% size difference, same crystal structure, similar electronegativity, same valence
questions.answer: 5% size difference, same crystal structure, similar electronegativity, same valence

questions.question: For a binary ionic compound MX, if the electronegativity of M is 1.2 and X is 3.8, what is the approximate percentage ionic character?
An edge dislocation in an FCC crystal has a Burgers vector of a/2⟨110⟩. If the lattice parameter is 0.36 nm, what is the magnitude of the Burgers vector?
In X-ray diffraction of a cubic crystal, if the first-order diffraction peak for the (200) planes occurs at 2θ = 44.5° using Cu Kα radiation (λ = 0.1542 nm), what is the lattice parameter?

For steady-state diffusion through a 2 mm thick steel plate at 700°C, if the carbon concentrations are 1.2 kg/m³ and 0.4 kg/m³ on opposite surfaces, and D = 2.5 × 10⁻¹¹ m²/s, what is the diffusion flux?
If a material has an ASTM grain size number G = 8, approximately how many grains per square inch would be observed at 100× magnification?
For a composition of 15 wt% Cu and 85 wt% Al, what is the approximate atomic percentage of copper? (Atomic weights: Cu = 63.5 g/mol, Al = 27.0 g/mol)
Which type of point defect would most significantly affect the electrical conductivity of a semiconductor?
options: Substitutional impurity atoms with different valence
questions.answer: Substitutional impurity atoms with different valence

questions.question: If the diffusion coefficient of carbon in α-iron at 500°C is 1.2 × 10⁻¹² m²/s, and the activation energy is 87.4 kJ/mol, what would be the diffusion coefficient at 600°C?
For an HCP crystal structure with c/a ratio = 1.633, if the atomic radius is 0.133 nm, what is the atomic packing factor?

In a carburizing process, if the surface carbon concentration is maintained at 1.2 wt% and the initial carbon content is 0.2 wt%, what depth would achieve 0.6 wt% carbon after 5 hours at 950°C? (D = 1.6 × 10⁻¹¹ m²/s)
